name: NPR
text:
Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms: “I truly believe that this is the year that Georgia will have gone blue and that this is Joe Biden’s year in our state.”
https://t.co/7d0hhdayct

name: NPR
text: If you needed a drink Tuesday night, you definitely weren't alone. Alcohol delivery service Drizly noted that sales jumped across the country, rising the most in blue states -- doubling in New York City and D.C. -- and among liquor and wine drinkers. https://t.co/dTTKd4osGm

name: NPR
text:
Ja’Ron Smith, one of the highest-ranking African American officials in the White House, has announced he’s leaving the administration. He said President Trump still has his support.
https://t.co/H2w2eZ1EdX

name: NPR
text: Less than 10 months ago, the Boston Red Sox parted ways with manager Alex Cora for his role in the Houston Astros sign-stealing scandal. Today, not long after the end of his MLB-mandated season-long suspension, they rehired him. https://t.co/yoEa1Hc6SL

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Georgia's second Senate race will head to a runoff between Democrat John Ossoff and GOP Sen. David Perdue, pushing back Democrats' hopes of a chamber takeover to January.
https://t.co/1rypmN18Nl
